responses:
Sorry, we do not have the data you asked for. If you are looking for your embassy, you may check the in this link
https://embassies.net/indonesia
Or you may call 112 for general emergency
Please call 110 or 112
Call (0361) 701111 or (0361) 8498008 for Bluebird taxi
Please call 118  or 119. Or you can ask locals using keyword PUSKESMAS or IGD
Please call 021- 4207051 for PMI
Please call 112 or 115 for SAR (Search and Rescue) and call 129 for evacuation post
Please shortly describe your emergency
Please call 1500-533 or SMS to number 0812-1999-9533
Please call your local fire department or 113

First, move the person to a safe place out of water.
Second, look for someone who can help or call 112. While you're at it, Try to call the drowning person and shake their shoulders to make sure they are responding.
If you're alone, follow the next steps. Check if the person is breathing or not by feel the mouth and nose and the chest
If the person is breathing: Place them in the recovery position and warm them up with clothes or blankets. Change their wet clothes while waiting for the ambulance.
If the person is not breathing, please elevate the head by placing a hand on the forehead and another hand down the chin and lifting it gently to clear the airway.
Check their pulse by placing two fingers on the windpipe for 10 seconds.
Perform CPR if you there is no pulse. Starting with carefully place the person on their back.
Place the heel of one hand on the center of the chest at the nipple line. You can also push with one hand on top of the other.
Press down at least 2 inches. Make sure not to press on ribs.
Do chest compressions only, at the rate of 100-120 per minute or more. Let the chest rise completely between pushes.
Check to see if the person has started breathing.
Please call 112 or 115 for Search and Rescue
Please call 123 for PLN
Please call 119 for Covid-19 Hotline in Indonesia
Please tell us which nationality?
Contact +62-21-2550-5555 for Australian Embassy or +62361-2000-100 for Consulate General of Australia in Denpasar
